intro: Desmodium seleri, commonly known as the small cowpea, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features trifoliate leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, pea-like flowers in shades of pink or white. Its pods are usually slender and contain several small, edible seeds. Desmodium seleri is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun.
